section.title: Tutorial 8: MyMine
section.para: It is possible to save bags, queries and templates permanently to FlyMine, in a personal FlyMine account called MyMine, by creating a log-in. Your MyMine account allows you to manage your saved items. To create a log-in, click on 'Log in' on the main menu bar at the top of each FlyMine page, and give an email address and password. To access your MyMine account click on 'MyMine' on the top menu bar.
Your MyMine page has four tabs: Bags, Saved queries, Saved templates and Favourite templates plus a tab to allow you to change your password.
In this tutorial we will look at how to save queries. See Tutorial 4 for information on how to save bags and Tutorial 7 for information on how to build and save your own template queries.

Every query that is run in FlyMine (template queries and queries constructed in the query builder, but not quick search queries) is automatically saved with a default name (format query_x (x=incrementing number). These are saved to your query history.

Find the template 'Gene --> Orthologues' under the 'Comparative genomics' aspect. Run this template with the default values provided. At the top of the results page notice that there is a message saying 'Saved in your query history as "query_x"'. You can access your query history from the top menu bar.

Your 'Query history' lists all the queries you have run in this particular session and gives the date and time they were run, the starting class of the query and the fields in the results (these latter two columns are more relevent if you have constructed a query yourself in the query builder or modified a template in the query builder). For each query there are also a set of actions: Run, Edit, Save and Export:

listitem.para: Run: will run the query directly.
Edit: Will take you either to the template form if you ran a template query or to the query builder if you constructed the query yourself (or modified a template).
Save: This allows you to save your query permanently to the 'Saved queries' tab of your MyMine account.
Export: This allows you to export the query as xml. This is useful if you want to give your query to someone else to use in FlyMine (queries saved as xml can be re-imported into FlyMine).

section.para: Navigate to your query history, find the query you just ran and click on 'Save'. You will automatically be taken to the 'Saved queries' tab of your MyMine page where you can find your saved query. Click on the blue circle next to the query name to re-name the query. Note that queries can also be re-named in your query history. Queries saved in your MyMine account have the same set of actions available as for the query history described above.

Queries constructed in the query builder can be saved directly to your MyMine account. At the bottom of the query builder page under 'Actions' is a box allowing you to name and save your query. This option is only available if you are logged in.
